Race.SpecificTitle: Mayor-President -- Metro Council, City of Baton Rouge
Councilman -- Metro District  1
Councilman -- Metro District  4
Councilman -- Metro District  6
Councilman -- Metro District  7
Councilman -- Metro District 10
Councilman -- Metro District 12
Councilman -- District 2, City of Zachary
St. George FPD No. 2 Proposition No. 1 of 3 -- 1.25 Mills Extension - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText: St. George Fire Protection District No. 2 Proposition No. 1 of 3
Race.FullText: Shall the St. George Fire Protection District No. 2 ("the District"), Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana, under the provisions of Article VI, Section 19 of the 1974 Constitution of Louisiana, Part I of Chapter 7 of Title 40 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended, and other constitutional and statutory authority supplemental thereto, be authorized to extend the levy and collection of the 1.25 mills annual ad valorem tax ("the Tax") on all property subject to taxation in the District presently authorized to be levied by the District through December 31, 2021 pursuant to an election held on October 22, 2011 for an additional ten (10) years up to and including the year 2031 (an estimated $1,250,000 is reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year, and this amount will increase if the value of property subject to taxation increases), and shall the avails or proceeds of said Tax be used entirely and exclusively for salaries, benefits and related expenses for the St. George Fire Protection District No. 2?

Race.SpecificTitle: St. George FPD No. 2 Proposition No. 2 of 3 -- 1.50 Mills Extension - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText: St. George Fire Protection District No. 2 Proposition No. 2 of 3
Race.FullText: Shall the St. George Fire Protection District No. 2 ("the District"), Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana, under the provisions of Article VI, Section 19 of the 1974 Constitution of Louisiana, Part I of Chapter 7 of Title 40 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended, and other constitutional and statutory authority supplemental thereto, be re-authorized to extend the levy and collection of an ad valorem tax of 1.50 mills ("the Tax") in each calendar year on all property subject to taxation in the District, presently authorized to be levied by the District through December 31, 2021 pursuant to an election held on November 8, 2016, for an additional ten (10) years up to and including the year 2031 (an estimated $1,500,000 is reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the Tax for the entire first year, and this amount will increase if the value of property subject to taxation increases), and shall the avails or proceeds of said Tax be used entirely and exclusively for capital improvements, and debt service for, the St. George Fire Protection District No. 2 within St. George Fire Protection District No. 2?

Race.SpecificTitle: St. George FPD No. 2 Proposition No. 3 of 3 -- $32.00 Service Charge - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText: St. George Fire Protection District No. 2 Proposition No. 3 of 3
Race.FullText: Shall the St. George Fire Protection District No. 2 ("the District"), Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana, under the provisions of Article VI, Section 19 of the 1974 Constitution of Louisiana, Part I of Chapter 7 of Title 40 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended (specifically La. R.S. 40:1502.1 et seq. and all amendatory thereto), and other constitutional and statutory authority supplemental thereto, be re-authorized to levy and collect a service charge not to exceed $32.00 per annum ("the Charge") from the owners of each residential or commercial structure located within the District (an estimated $1,000,000 is reasonably expected to be collected for the first year, and this amount will increase if the number of properties subject to the Charge increases) in each calendar year on all such property in the District for a period of ten (10) years, commencing in the year 2022 to and including the year 2031, and shall the avails or proceeds of said service charge be used for the development, operation and maintenance of the facilities of the District and paying the costs of obtaining water including fire hydrant rentals and fees, within the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Chaneyville FPD No. 7 Prop. No. 1 of 2 -- 15 Mills In Lieu - MC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText: Chaneyville Fire Protection District No. 7 Proposition No. 1 of 2
Race.FullText: Shall the Chaneyville Fire Protection District No. 7 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana (the "District"), be authorized to levy and collect a fifteen (15) mills ad valorem tax (the "Tax"), beginning in the year 2021 to and including the year 2030 (an estimated $96,000 is reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), in each calendar year on all property subject to taxation in the District, and shall the avails or proceeds of said Tax (after paying reasonable and necessary expenses of collection and administering the Tax, if any) be used by the District to acquire, construct, improve, maintain and/or operate facilities and equipment to provide fire protection services in and for the District, including the purchase of fire trucks and other fire fighting equipment, and to pay the costs of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, including hydrant rentals and service in lieu of the ten (10) mills ad valorem tax approved by voters on November 19, 2011 currently levied by the District for the same purposes for a ten (10) year period, beginning with the year 2012 and ending with the year 2021?

Race.SpecificTitle: Chaneyville FPD No. 7 Prop. No. 2 of 2 -- $32.00 Service Charge Renewal - MC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText: Chaneyville Fire Protection District No. 7 Proposition No. 2 of 2
Race.FullText: Shall the Chaneyville Fire Protection District No. 7, Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana (the "District"), be authorized to renew the levy and collection, and adopt an ordinance providing for such levy and collection, of a service charge of $32.00 per annum (the "Service Charge") (an estimated $42,000 is reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the Service Charge for an entire year), for each liveable residential or commercial structure, whether occupied or unoccupied, located wholly or partly within the boundaries of the District (which Service Charge shall be levied after the expiration of the service charge approved by the voters in the District on April 30, 2011), in each calendar year, for a period of ten (10) years, commencing in the year 2022 to and including the year 2031, and shall the avails or proceeds of the Service Charge (after paying the reasonable and necessary expenses of collection and administering the Service Charge; if any) be used entirely and exclusively for fire protection purposes within the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Broadmoor Crime Prevention and Improvement Dist. -- $100 Parcel Fee Renewal - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText: Broadmoor Crime Prevention and Improvement District Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall Broadmoor Crime Prevention and Improvement District ("District"), be authorized to renew the annual parcel fee of $100 on each improved and unimproved parcel within the District, beginning in 2023 and ending in 2032, and shall the District's Board be authorized to increase the annual parcel fee as provided in La. R.S. 33:9097.8, to an amount not to exceed $150, with the proceeds of the parcel fee to be used to aid in crime prevention and to add to the security of District residents by providing for an increase in the presence of law enforcement personnel in the District, and to serve the needs of the District's residents by funding beautification and improvements for the overall betterment of the District ($195,000 is reasonably expected to be collected from the initial collection)?

Race.SpecificTitle: Forest Oak Windsor Crime Prev. & Improv. Dist. -- $175 Parcel Fee - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText: Forest Oak Windsor Place Crime Prevention, Improvement, and Beautification District Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall Forest Oak Windsor Place Crime Prevention, Improvement, and Beautification District ("District"), be authorized to levy and collect the annual parcel fee on each improved and unimproved parcel within the District for a period of 10 years, beginning in 2021 and ending in 2030, not to exceed $175 per parcel on each lot zoned for residential use and not to exceed $500 per parcel on each lot zoned for commercial use, except lots whose owner qualifies for the special assessment level provided by Article VII, Section 18(G)(1) of the Constitution of Louisiana which shall be 50% of the amount of the fee that would otherwise be imposed on such a parcel, as provided in Act No. 260 (2020) enacting La. R.S. 33:9097.32, with the proceeds of the parcel fee to be used to provide or enhance security patrols in the District, to provide improved lighting, signage, or matters relating to the security of the District, to provide for the beautification of and improvements for the District, and to provide generally for the overall betterment of the District (an estimated $296,100 is reasonably expected to be collected from the initial collection)?

Race.SpecificTitle: Jefferson Place/Bocage Crime Prev. and Imp. Dist. -- $500 Parcel Fee Renewal - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Jefferson Place/Bocage Crime Prevention and Improvement District Proposition
(Parcel Fee Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall Jefferson Place/Bocage Crime Prevention and Improvement District ("District") be authorized to renew the annual parcel fee of $500 for promoting and encouraging security, the beautification, and overall betterment of the area included within the District and for all related matters set forth in La. R.S. 33:9097.12 for 10 years beginning in 2022 and ending in 2031 and shall the District's Board be authorized to increase said parcel fee to an amount not to exceed $540 by duly adopted resolution of the District's Board on each improved parcel provided that no annual parcel fee shall be imposed on any parcel whose owner qualified for and received, prior to January 1, 2020, the special assessment level provided by Article VII, Section 18(G)(1) of the Constitution of Louisiana (the estimated collection is $190,000)?

Race.SpecificTitle: Jefferson Place/Bocage Crime Prev. and Imp. Dist. -- District Expansion - BOC
Race.SummaryText:
Jefferson Place/Bocage Crime Prevention and Improvement District Proposition
(Expansion)
Race.FullText: Shall the boundaries of the Jefferson Place/Bocage Crime Prevention and Improvement District ("District") be expanded to include Lots 39, 40, 41, 42A, 43 and 44 of Bocage Lakes Subdivision, as established on the official subdivision plat filed with the East Baton Rouge Parish Clerk of Court where, if approved by the voters of the District, each improved parcel will be subject to an annual parcel fee of $500 for promoting and encouraging security, the beautification, and overall betterment of the District and for all related matters as set forth in La. R.S. 33:9097.12 for 10 years beginning in 2022 and ending in 2031 and subject to increase by the District's Board to an amount not to exceed $540 provided no annual parcel fee shall be imposed on any parcel whose owner qualified for and received the special assessment level provided by Article VII, Section 18(G)(1) of the Constitution of Louisiana, prior to January 1, 2020 (the estimated initial collection is $3,000)?

Race.SpecificTitle: South Burbank Crime Prev. and Dev. Dist. -- $100.00/$25.00 Parcel Fee Renewal - BOC - 4 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText: South Burbank Crime Prevention and Development District Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall the South Burbank Crime Prevention and Development District (the "District"), through the Board of Commissioners of the District and the East Baton Rouge Parish Metropolitan Council, be authorized to renew a levy and collect an annual fee on each improved parcel of land located within the District in the amount of One Hundred Dollars ($100.00) for a residential or commercial structure; Twenty-Five Dollars ($25.00) for each unit in a condominium, residential, or commercial structure with four or more units, which fee shall be levied for a period of four (4) years, commencing on January 1, 2022 (an estimated $192,855.00 expected at the time to be collected from the levy of the fee for the entire year) and which fee shall be collected by any means authorized by law for the collection of taxes, as provided in La. R.S. 33:9097.2, the proceeds of said fee (after deducting the reasonable and necessary costs of collecting said fee) to be used in crime prevention and enhanced security of District residents by providing an increase of law enforcement or contracted security personnel in the District and creation of a crime free housing program and for other purposes permitted by applicable law?

Race.SpecificTitle: Park Forest East Crime Prev. and Improv. Dist. -- $70.00 Parcel Fee Renewal - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText: Park Forest East Crime Prevention and Improvement District Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall the Park Forest East Crime Prevention and Improvement District (the "District"), be authorized to renew the annual fee on each parcel of land located within the boundaries of the District in the amount of Seventy Dollars ($70.00), which fee shall be levied for a period of ten (10) years, commencing on January 1, 2022 and ending in 2031, and shall the District's Board be authorized to increase the parcel fee up to One Hundred Fifty dollars ($150.00), as provided in LSA R.S. 33:9097.10, with the proceeds of the parcel fee to be used to aid in crime prevention and enhance security of the District residents by providing for an increase of law enforcement and security patrols within the District and to provide for maintenance and improvement of areas with the District (an estimated $56,500 is reasonably expected to be collect from the initial collection)?

Race.SpecificTitle: Westminster Pine Park Crime Prev. & Improv. Dist. -- $100 Parcel Fee Renewal - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText: Westminster Pine Park Crime Prevention and Neighborhood Improvement District Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall the Westminster Pine Park Crime Prevention and Neighborhood Improvement District ("District") be authorized to renew the annual parcel fee of $100 on each improved parcel within the District for 10 years beginning in 2021 and ending in 2030, and shall the District's Board be authorized to increase the parcel fee up to a maximum parcel fee of $130, as provided in La. R.S. 33:9097.11 with the proceeds of the parcel fee to be used to aid in crime prevention and enhance security of District residents by providing for an increase of law enforcement and security patrols within the District and to provide for the maintenance and improvement of areas within the District (an estimated $76,960 is reasonably expected to be collected from the initial collection)?

Race.SpecificTitle: Hospital Service District No. 1 -- 20 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the Hospital Service District No. 1 of East Baton Rouge Parish, Louisiana (the "District") be authorized to levy and collect a 20 mills ad valorem tax on the dollar of assessed valuation on all property subject to taxation within the boundaries of the District (the "Tax") (an estimated $5,400,000 is reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), commencing with the tax collection for the year 2021, to and including the tax collection for the year 2030, and shall the proceeds of the Tax (after paying reasonable and necessary expenses of collecting and administering the Tax) be used entirely and exclusively for the purpose of COVID-19 related capital improvements at, and ongoing operations of, Lane Regional Medical Center?
